column4: one more question, when I started live ubuntu, it was working great, but the installed version keps giving me trouble, like refusing to open networking, and similar services, and neither one can see my win partition? with mandriva I could do that, and in knoppix too...
what could be wrong?

I have serious issues with 5.10! when running live CD everything is ok, but when I install it half the things don't work! for example, I go to system-> administration -> networking and it starts to load and just dissapears! and that's not the only thing that fails!
and I can't read NTFS disks!
one thing at a time, did you do an expert install?
and everything looked ok
ok, just to check.  what does 'sudo echo hi' do in applications menu > accessories > terminal
I installed it from the install disk
you lost me
I'm using live cd now, and all things work, earlyer today I installed 5.10 from installation CD, it booted up, and when I tryed to run half the things, the aplications just stalled!
go to your install and come here again :)
the same thing happend with 5.04
it's known to happen with expert installs, we can fix it
and when I run install cd, I can't configure my modem
one problem at a time, let's fix the gui admin apps first
that's the problem, I can't come here with install CD, so if you can tell me what to do, I'll try it offline
oh right... didn't click in my head :)  Sorry.  Do you know what 'su to root' means?
yes
ok su to root in console and then follow ubotu's instructions
thanks
Hi I was here an houre ago, I was having problems with expert install, and I did what ubuto told me, and I still can't access administarive apps
